reviews.text: Just had a long weekend in Berlin with my mum. Hotel location was excellent with a U-bahn station 5 mins walk and bus stops near by. The public transport is incredibly easy to use with most bus stops showing which buses leave, where they go and how often. Can get single/return or day tickets and is cheaper than public trasnsport in England. Once you have a decent map you will negotiate the buses no problem. You can buy tickets on board or at machines which have an english option on the screen.
reviews.title: Great location and great breakfast....

reviews.text: This hotel was located just off the kurfurstendam, which is a long road leading to the Europa Centre - shoppng area and square with buskers, fab ice cream cafe's and amazing old church with modern chapel attached, which looks ugly from the outside but is amazing inside. The kurfstendam starts with the most designer shops and becomes more high street the further towards the Europa centre you get.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although not fancy, the accomodations were clean, comfortable and in an excellent location which was both attractive and convenient to shopping, restaurants and public transit. I found the staff to be helpful and friendly - they tolerated my poor attempts at German with good humor and fair English. We arrived quite late, well after midnight and found that the night clerk had been on the lookout for us as he walked out to meet us when I pulled up in front. The downstairs lobby is small but functional and the hallways are spartan, no extra money was spent on furnishing/decorating - my boyfriend wanted to know if we were staying in a barracks. However, once in the room, we were comfortable with feather comfortors, platform beds, a squeaky clean bathroom and shower gel provided by the hotel which I liked so much, I have been seeking to buy it for myself. The buffet breakfast provided is very good - a full buffet with a variety of hot & cold food items - and an excellent value, especially if you consider the price of the room. If you exit the lobby to the street, turn left and proceed one block, you will find a convenient, well stocked little grocery store which should have just about anything you require at a reasonable price. Just before crossing over to the store, you will see a bistro/restaurant on the left - I don't recall the name but the food smelled wonderful and everyone inside appeared to be having a good time. Unfortunately we did not get to eat there but I was told that it is quite good. If/when I return to Berlin, I will stay here again.
reviews.title: Good Location, Friendly Staff, Excellent Value

Great base
reviews.text: This hotel was great as a base if you are wanting to do all the sightseeing and nightlife of Berlin. It is a 4/5 min walk to the nearest tube station and main bus stops and the tube network in Berlin is excellent and works the exact same way as London but is much cleaner, safer and generally more pleasant! (Oh and really cheap - the tickets you uy on the tube also work for the buses - but no one checked ours once over the whole 3 days we were there! - ut buy one anyway just incase - there are machines on the platforms and outside at the main bus stations)

reviews.title: friendly hotel
reviews.text: The Hotel itself was fine - what you would expect for a 75 pp hotel, pretty basic, very large room to single beds to make a double, but serioursly weird pillows so Id ask for an extra one on arrival as u are bound to need! Also no ironing facilities and it looks like they only have one iron and board for the whole hotel so if you know you are going to need it ask for it in good time! Admittedly becasue we had such good nights out in Berlin we embarassingly didnt manage to get up for the included breakfast - but from what we saw it looked fine - dining room very traditional , clean, no problems. Theres a mega slow PC in the lounge area if you need to check email or anything. Be warned that the room we were in had no shower curtain - the shower was fab with really high pressure and good temperature at all hours but it was very easy to flood the bathromm first time round so be careful! Overall though the hotel was absokutely fine as a base, very clean, comfortable and in a good location, Id stay there again.

reviews.title: Excellent value for money
reviews.text: Onto Berlin itself, a few tips we would like to have had beforehand that we can now pass on!;

- The tube network runs througout the night which was excellent and they come about every 20 mins after 11pm and constantly througout the day so dont worry about paying for a taxi if you go out (and there didnt seem to be the usual weirdos you get on tubes at 3am in the morning!)

reviews.text: - To get to the hotel from the airport get the bus to RUDROW and then the tube to ADENAUERPLATZ (the light blue line on the map U7 line)
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arriving at the hotel we found the room to be basic but clean and functional. The beds were comfortable and we had a fairly large tv in the room which had CNN as the only english speaking channel (but who goes on holiday to watch tv?). The breakfast was substantial with cereals and fresh fruit, breads meats and cheeses as well as scrambled and boiled eggs and hot dog sausages. The only problem we had during our stay was that after 2 days our room had not been cleaned. I went down to reception to ask for clean towels and she said that the room had not been done because we had taken the key out with us. However the next morning the maids let themselves into the room with their own key while we were still in it! The other couple we were travelling with had no problems though. Their room was cleaned daily! The hotel is only 5 minutes walk to adenauerplatz u bahn station and outside that is the bus stop with frequent buses to zoo station where you can get the s bahn to all of the main sights in the east of Berlin. The Ku'dam is only a 5 minute walk away for all of the designer shops etc. 5 minutes on the bus will take you to the other end of the Ku'dam for KaDeWe and the Kaiser Willhiem Memorial Church. The hotel does not have a bar but there are plenty of pubs and restaurants near by as well as a supermarket and a 24 hour shop, so there is always something available!
reviews.title: Basic, but ok if you're on a budget

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel when we were visiting the city of Berlin for 4 nights. Was really impressed with the location of the hotel. In a quiet and seemingly affluent area also near to lots of shops & restaurants. The hotel is a mere 3-5min walk from the nearest Ubahn station. Public transport in Berlin is second to none and definately made my trip all the more enjoyable allowing us to see everything including the more far away attractions.
reviews.title: Beautiful Berlin
